Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of surface-to-air missiles that fell into the hands of radical Islamists in Libya.
Understate: The claim understates the efforts made by the United States to destroy man-portable air-defense systems (MANPADS) globally.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that radical Islamist groups obtained thousands of Libyan MANPADS.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that U.S. military involvement in Libya is solely responsible for the surface-to-air missiles falling into the hands of radical Islamists.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for how the surface-to-air missiles ended up in the hands of radical Islamists, such as smuggling or other actors involved in the conflict.
